about.title: BE AWARE
about.subtitle: Welcome to BE AWARE
about.description: Welcome to the BE AWARE project – Business Engagement for Advancing Work Accessibility and Retention for Employees with disabilities (2025-1-PT01-KA210-VET-000351315), an initiative aimed at strengthening employer engagement and fostering inclusive employment opportunities for disabled individuals.
about.paragraph1: BE AWARE is an Erasmus+ project improving employment opportunities for individuals with disabilities in Portugal and Bulgaria. The project has a duration of 18 months, running from 01/10/2025 to 31/03/2027. It strengthens the employer engagement skills of Supported Employment (SE) professionals and provides employers with practical tools to promote disability-inclusive recruitment.
about.paragraph2: Through a blended training programme, a Best Practice Handbook, a collaborative World Café Session, and national events in both countries, BE AWARE helps create more inclusive workplaces and supports sustainable job placements for disabled jobseekers.

objectives.intro: The BE AWARE project aims to increase employment opportunities for individuals with disabilities by strengthening the employer engagement skills of Supported Employment (SE) professionals in Bulgaria and Portugal. In doing so, the project directly addresses a critical skills gap within vocational training and contributes to building a more inclusive labour market across Europe.

supportedEmploymentProfessionals.title: Training Program for Supported Employment Professionals
supportedEmploymentProfessionals.body: Develop and implement a blended training programme for 30 SE professionals, equipping them with practical, employer-focused engagement strategies to improve job placements for individuals with disabilities.

employers.title: Good Practices Manual for Employers
employers.body: Create a Best Practice Handbook (BPH) for employers, providing real-world success stories, actionable recruitment strategies, and guidance on disability-inclusive hiring practices.

capacitation.title: Pilot Training
capacitation.body: Pilot the training in Bulgaria and Portugal, evaluating its effectiveness through feedback from SE professionals and employers to ensure long-term relevance, applicability, and refinement.

event.title: World Café Session (WCS)
event.body: Organise a World Café Session (WCS) with 20–25 stakeholders, including SE professionals, employers, and individuals with disabilities, to collaboratively refine approaches to effective employer engagement.

dissemination.title: Dissemination and Valorisation
dissemination.body: Disseminate and scale up project results through multiplier events and a dedicated online campaign, ensuring broad uptake of the training programme and the BPH.

targetGroups.title: Target Groups
targetGroups.intro: The BE AWARE project aims to enhance employment outcomes for individuals with disabilities by strengthening the capacity of Supported Employment (SE) services across Bulgaria and Portugal. To achieve this, several key target groups are directly and indirectly involved.

body.paragraph1: A direct target group comprising job coaches, employment consultants, social workers, and vocational counsellors who support individuals with disabilities in securing and maintaining employment. Many lack structured training in employer engagement and face difficulties in promoting jobseekers and establishing employer partnerships.
body.paragraph2: BE AWARE addresses this by developing and implementing a blended training programme for 30 SE professionals, equipping them with practical employer engagement strategies and increased confidence.

body.paragraph1: A second direct target group including public bodies, private companies, and associations employing or potentially employing individuals with disabilities. Employers often express uncertainty regarding inclusive recruitment, including concerns about productivity, reasonable adjustments, legal matters, or stigma.
body.paragraph2: To address these barriers, the project develops a Best Practice Handbook (BPH) containing success stories, actionable guidance, and strategies for disability-inclusive recruitment. Employers participate in the World Café Session to ensure outputs reflect real labour market needs.

body.paragraph1: Indirect beneficiaries and the ultimate focus of the project. With only 50.8% of disabled individuals in employment across the EU, strengthened support services are vital. BE AWARE improves the quality of SE provision, increasing the likelihood of successful job placements.
body.paragraph2: Disabled individuals contribute through targeted questionnaires and participation in the WCS, ensuring project outcomes align with their needs.

targetGroups.conclusion: Through this integrated approach, BE AWARE strengthens SE professionals’ capacity, addresses employer concerns, and actively removes employment barriers for individuals with disabilities.

activities.title: Activities
activities.intro: The BE AWARE project develops, validates, and disseminates high-quality resources to address the employer engagement skills gap among Supported Employment (SE) professionals in Bulgaria and Portugal. Activities are structured around four core components.

paragraph1.intro: Development of a blended training programme and accompanying resources to strengthen SE professionals’ employer engagement competencies. Co-designed by partners and SE professionals, the training covers:
paragraph1.bullet3: understanding employer needs and recruitment processes
paragraph1.bullet5: fundamentals of national labour law related to disability employment

body.paragraph1: Implementation of the training package with 30 SE professionals (15 per country) to assess its practicality, relevance, and effectiveness.
body.paragraph2: Evaluation through pre- and post-training questionnaires, practical assignments, and real-life application ensures the final methodology is robust and transferable across Supported Employment settings.

body.paragraph1: Development of a comprehensive handbook for employers and SE professionals showcasing inclusion success stories, proven strategies, and actionable advice. Content is informed by needs analysis and refined through a World Café Session involving 20–25 stakeholders, ensuring diverse and realistic perspectives.

paragraph1.intro: Promotion of project results, including the training package and BPH, through:
paragraph1.bullet1: two multiplier events: BE AWARE Day Portugal and BE AWARE Day Bulgaria
paragraph1.bullet2: a dedicated online campaign promoting disability-inclusive hiring and employer awareness
paragraph1.outro: Through these activities, the project builds SE professionals’ capacity, supports employers in adopting inclusive practices, and contributes to long-term systemic improvements in employment opportunities for individuals with disabilities.

results.title: Results
results.intro: The BE AWARE project generates concrete outcomes that strengthen the professional inclusion of individuals with disabilities by enhancing the capacity of SE professionals and employers.

bullet1.title: Project Website
bullet1.body: A digital platform providing project information, news, and centralised access to resources.

bullet2.title: Informational Materials
bullet2.body: Brochures, leaflets, posters, and templates supporting visibility and outreach.

bullet3.title: Blended Training Programme
bullet3.body: A structured training package including theoretical content, practical tools, and blended learning components focused on employer engagement.

bullet4.title: Pilot Training Activity Report
bullet4.body: Documentation and evaluation of the pilot implementation with 30 SE professionals, assessing relevance, effectiveness, and transferability.

bullet5.title: Best Practice Handbook (BPH)
bullet5.body: A comprehensive resource compiling success stories, proven strategies, and disability-inclusive recruitment and retention practices, refined through the WCS.

bullet6.title: World Café Session (WCS)
bullet6.body: A collaborative session with 20–25 stakeholders—employers, SE professionals, and individuals with disabilities—informing the BPH.

bullet7.title: Promotional Video Spot
bullet7.body: An animated video for online dissemination and awareness-raising on disability-inclusive employment.

bullet8.title: Online Awareness Campaign
bullet8.body: A dedicated campaign to expand project reach and encourage inclusive hiring.

bullet9.title: Multiplier Events
bullet9.body: Two large-scale events—BE AWARE Day Portugal and BE AWARE Day Bulgaria—to present outcomes and support national-level scale-up.

bullet10.title: Stakeholder Network
bullet10.body: A strengthened multi-country network focused on promoting work accessibility and inclusion for individuals with disabilities.

bullet1.title: Enhanced SE Professional Capacity
bullet1.body: SE professionals gain improved employer engagement skills and increased confidence, contributing to more effective Supported Employment practices.

bullet2.title: Increased Employment Opportunities
bullet2.body: Better employer engagement and reduced hiring barriers lead to improved labour market access for individuals with disabilities.

bullet3.title: Long-Term Systemic Improvement
bullet3.body: Employers receive practical tools (e.g., the BPH) supporting sustainable, inclusive recruitment practices.

bullet4.title: Policy Alignment and Transferability
bullet4.body: The project supports national implementation of the EU Strategy for the Rights of Persons with Disabilities 2021–2030 and the EU Disability Employment Package. Outputs are designed for transferability across Europe.

bullet5.title: Sustained Resource Availability
bullet5.body: The training package and BPH remain accessible through partner and international platforms, promoting long-term adaptation and use beyond the project’s duration.

consultis.name: Consultis
consultis.paragraph1: CONSULTIS is an organisation founded in 2005 and based in Vila Nova de Gaia, Portugal, specialising in business consultancy, education and training, innovation, and Supported Employment. As an active member of the Portuguese Association of Supported Employment, it operates a Resource Centre in Porto, where it provides support to businesses, professionals, and jobseekers, particularly to groups facing disadvantage in the labour market, such as disabled individuals, young people at risk of social exclusion, migrants, and the long-term unemployed.
consultis.paragraph2: In collaboration with businesses, training entities, educational institutions, social sector organisations, and public bodies, CONSULTIS develops solutions aligned with labour market needs, promoting effective strategies for professional and social inclusion. Through the services it provides, CONSULTIS supports the implementation of more inclusive and sustainable employment practices, ensuring continuous support for employers and for individuals in the process of labour market integration.
consultis.address: Centro de Recursos em Emprego Apoiado, Rua Calouste Gulbenkian, nº52, 5º andar, E7, 4050-144 Porto, Portuga

rumo.paragraph1: RUMO, Cooperativa de Solidariedade Social, Crl, is a non-profit organisation  founded in 1981 and based in Barreiro, Portugal. Its mission is to promote educational, professional, and community inclusion for disadvantaged individuals, within the framework of the Supported Employment Movement. A founding member of the Portuguese Association for Supported Employment, RUMO works in areas such as vocational training, labour market integration, and support for vulnerable groups, including people with disabilities or impairments. Networking is essential for the development of Rumo, as partnerships are key to effective management. Through partnerships, different individuals, teams, and organisations can work together to address common interests and concerns.
rumo.paragraph2: RUMO collaborates within a network of employers, public institutions, civil society organisations, vocational training centres, and self-advocacy groups, raising awareness of the rights of disadvantaged individuals and those at risk of social exclusion, offering support for labour market integration, professional training, and other services.
rumo.address: Parque Empresarial do Barreiro – Rua 19, nº13, 2830-904, Barreiro, Portugal

nfedp.paragraph1: The National Federation of Employers of Disabled People (NFEDP) is a leading Bulgarian organisation representing the interests of employers who actively support the labour-market inclusion of persons with disabilities. With more than 15 years of experience, NFEDP promotes disability-inclusive employment practices, advocates for equal opportunities, and contributes to national policy development in the field of employment and vocational rehabilitation.
nfedp.paragraph2: NFEDP works closely with companies, public authorities, and civil society stakeholders to remove structural barriers, improve workplace accessibility, and foster employer confidence in hiring disabled workers. Its activities include employer counselling, awareness-raising, labour-market research, and participation in national and European strategic initiatives promoting inclusive employment.

bist.paragraph1: SDRUJENIE “BYLGARSKI EKIP ZA PRIOBSHTAVASHTA PODKREPA” (BIST) is a Bulgarian non-profit organisation dedicated to promoting inclusive support services and improving employment outcomes for individuals with disabilities. BIST works at the intersection of education, social support, and labour market inclusion, developing initiatives that empower disadvantaged groups and strengthen the capacity of professionals and organisations working in Supported Employment.
bist.paragraph2: The organisation engages in awareness-raising, professional development activities, community-based interventions, and collaboration with employers to address stigma, increase disability confidence, and promote accessible recruitment practices. BIST also contributes to national and European networks advocating for disability rights and inclusive labour market reforms.
bist.address: 24 Kukuryak str, ground floor, office 6, 1618 Sofia, Bulgaria

accessibility.title: Accessibility Statement

commitment.title: Our Commitment to Accessibility
commitment.body: The BE AWARE project is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for people with disabilities. We are continually improving the user experience for everyone and applying the relevant accessibility standards.

conformance.title: Conformance Status
conformance.body: The Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) defines requirements for designers and developers to improve accessibility for people with disabilities. It defines three levels of conformance: Level A, Level AA, and Level AAA.
conformance.status: This website is fully conformant with WCAG 2.1 Level AA.
conformance.meaning: Fully conformant means that the content fully conforms to the accessibility standard without any exceptions.

measures.title: Accessibility Measures
measures.intro: The BE AWARE project ensures accessibility through the following measures:

items.mission: Including accessibility as part of our mission statement
items.procurement: Integrating accessibility into our procurement practices
items.training: Providing ongoing accessibility training for our staff
items.goals: Assigning clear accessibility goals and responsibilities
items.qa: Employing formal accessibility quality assurance methods

specs.title: Technical Specifications
specs.intro: Accessibility of this website relies on the following technologies to work with the particular combination of web browser and any assistive technologies or plugins installed on your computer:

keyboard.body: Full keyboard accessibility for all interactive elements
